verses.text: I love the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*, for he hears my voice, my pleas for mercy.
For he has inclined his ear to me: I will call upon him as long as I live.
About me were snares of death, the anguish of Sheol was upon me: distress and sorrow were mine.
Then I called on the name of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*: ‘I beseech you, O \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*, deliver me.’
Gracious and just is the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*, compassionate is our God.
The \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*preserves the simple; when I was drooping, he saved me.
Be at peace, my heart, once more, for the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*has been good to you.
You have rescued me from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.
Before the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*I will walk in the land of the living.
I held fast my faith, though I said, ‘Ah me! I am sore afflicted,’
though in my alarm I said, ‘Everyone is a liar.’
What shall I render the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*for all his bounty to me?
I will lift up the cup of salvation, and call on the name of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*.
I will pay my vows to the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*in the presence of all his people.
Grave in the eyes of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*is the death of his loyal and loved ones.
Ah, \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*! I am your servant, your servant, child of your handmaid. You have loosened my bonds.
I will offer to you a thank-offering, and call on the name of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*.
I will pay my vows to the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*in the presence of all his people,
in the courts of the house of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*, in the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Hallelujah.
